intro: Caoutchoua elastica, commonly known as the rubber vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its latex sap, similar to natural rubber, has been historically used in various industrial applications. Caoutchoua elastica thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
